This ruling emphasizes constitutional supremacy over parliamentary discretion.

'Fatwa issued': BJP defends Tharoor for PM praise; takes 'Nazi' jab at Cong
description: BJP slammed Congress for criticising Shashi Tharoor's praise of PM Modi's speech, dubbing the party 'Indira Nazi Congress' for its 'emergency mindset' and discouraging internal dissent. While Tharoor lauded Modi's focus on development and cultural heritage, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate found the address unimpressive and questioned Tharoor's appreciation.

title: Bengaluru’s Mantri Mall shut again over unpaid property tax dues, reopens after court’s intervention

Instagram CEO: 2 qualities that drive top AI talent beyond Ivy League
description: AI talent is in high demand. Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri highlights scrappiness and rapid learning as key traits for top AI engineers.  Traditional degrees are less important than hands-on experience.  This shift offers new opportunities for aspiring professionals in the evolving AI field.  Competition for these skilled individuals is intense.

title: Pakistan Asia's second best team? Sikandar Raza gives 'African' answer; flips script
description: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza deflected a reporter's question about Asian T20 team rankings, stating his focus is solely on his national team. He asserted Zimbabwe's position as the second-best team in Africa. Raza also suggested that reaching the tri-series final might be considered an upset by some.

From processed snacks to salt: 5 foods your kidneys hate, and why
description: The consumption of processed foods, which includes packaged snacks, deli meats and ready-to-eat meals, leads to kidney damage, because these products contain artificial ingredients, and unhealthy fats and excessive salt. Research indicates that consuming ultra-processed foods (UPFs) leads to kidney disease development, that accelerates kidney function deterioration

description: Stokes urged England to approach the contest with clarity after selectors kept their options open by naming off-spinner Shoaib Bashir in a 12-man squad for the first Test. In September, England head coach Brendon McCullum had said this Ashes was "the biggest series of all our lives". Stokes agreed, telling Sky Sports, "we’d be lying to ourselves" to say otherwise.

'Out only in gully cricket': Ashwin on bizarre Ranji dismissal for hitting ball twice
description: A rare 'hit the ball twice' dismissal occurred in the Ranji Trophy, with Manipur's Lamabam Ajay Singh given out for deliberately using his bat to stop the ball from hitting the stumps. This unusual mode of dismissal, governed by MCC Law 34, hasn't been seen in the Ranji Trophy since 2005. R Ashwin reacted sharply to the same on X.

Jasprit Bumrah is also expected to be rested from the ODI matches due to workload management, with the focus shifting to T20Is until the next IPL.

Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders voiced concerns over the Election Commission's voter roll revision exercise, alleging it could disenfranchise legitimate voters and calling it a "sinister attempt to destroy Democracy."

Building AGI is ‘anti-goal’: Microsoft AI CEO issues warning; claims 'it will be hard to control'
description: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges caution against developing artificial superintelligence (ASI), deeming it an "anti-goal" due to control and alignment risks. Instead, his team focuses on "humanist superintelligence" to support human interests. This contrasts with figures like OpenAI's Sam Altman, who sees ASI as a key goal for accelerating discovery and prosperity.

title: The house of Lalu: Inside the slow, painful unraveling of Bihar’s most powerful political dynasty
description: Bihar's 2025 election results have triggered a significant crisis within the Rashtriya Janata Dal, leading to a dramatic drop in seats and exposing deep-seated family and organizational rifts.  The fallout includes public declarations of departure and accusations of gatekeeping, casting a shadow over the party's future stability and leadership.

title: Cambridge picks 'parasocial' as word of the year: What it means
description: Parasocial language has quietly reshaped how today’s youth think, learn, and plan their futures. What began as one-sided admiration has evolved into emotional outsourcing, where influencers and AI systems function as mentors, motivators, and confidants. This shift alters classroom engagement, blurs career expectations, and challenges students to distinguish digital intimacy from genuine connection.

title: F-35s, AI chips, and trillions: How MBS, once a ‘pariah’, took back Washington
description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, once a pariah, has made a remarkable comeback in Washington, securing significant US investment and military hardware.  His visit, marked by military fanfare and high-profile meetings, underscores Saudi Arabia's renewed strategic importance to the US, despite lingering human rights concerns. MBS skillfully leveraged geopolitical competition to his advantage.

title: Explainer: What to check before buying an air purifier; key features, common myths busted
description: Air quality impacts health, making air purifiers a household necessity. This guide explains how they work, the filters used, and key buying factors like CADR ratings. It debunks common myths and offers maintenance tips. Understanding costs and exploring alternative tech solutions like face masks are also covered. Proper selection and usage ensure cleaner indoor air for everyone.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
description: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: 'Safe' trap: How 19 women were drawn into extremism by Dr Shaheen; all untraceable
description: Authorities are actively searching for 19 women from Kanpur and surrounding areas who were reportedly influenced by arrested Jaish-e-Mohammed operative Dr. Shaheen Shahid. Investigators believe these women were radicalized through her manipulative speeches and outreach network.  Efforts are underway to locate them using various tracking methods to understand Dr. Shaheen's full operation.

title: Taylor Swift’s new song sparks Joe Alwyn breakup buzz, not Travis Kelce
description: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Taylor Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
description: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.
